intro: Centaurea stohlii, commonly known as the Stohl's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution, Centaurea stohlii is considered a rare and endangered species.
